title: HOW DOES THIS STILL HAPPEN. [ FELLOW PLAYER INTING]

embed.description: Album with topic of Gaming, tagged with and ; uploaded by syncoroll. how can this be allowed to happen still....

body:
Shouldn't riot already implement a failsafe for people who intentionally feed?

Why i do get a 10 game low priority ban for accidentally forgetting to pick a champion while players like these get to actually play and feed?

What is actually being implemented here.

replies.body:
I'm really sorry you had to experience that. It sucks balls to lose a game cause of that and I feel you man =(

To answer your question what is actually being implemented here;

You can read all about our systems here;
http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour/Y9YJ60Fn-player-behaviour-faq

We have Intentional Feeder Detection

> What about intentional feeders?
> 
> There is a separate system that focuses purely on feeders. If someone is feeding intentionally in multiple games then they will face temporary account suspensions and possible bans if they show no signs of reform.

It's there and we continue to have a team dedicated to improving the experience for you all. It's not perfect but we continue to iterate and improve as we move on. Unfortunately there has been a delay in updates and features in this space because of all the work required to bring it all into the updated client, but as that gets closer to release and moves out of beta you should see more progress in the Player Behaviour space.

I went to investigate whats going on here....and lets just say the system has already investigated and taken the necessary action on the account.

But to be honest, punishments alone wont prevent you from having this experience again. Punishments might help you feel a sense of justice after the fact but it doesn't shield you completely from experiencing it in the first place. It will prevent a little bit as some players may be deterred knowing that punishments are in place.

> There is no silver bullet that solves negative behavior in online games. Players are a diverse bunch, and each player has different motivations and responds differently to different consequences. We design diverse systems using three core philosophies based on reform, punishment, and reward.

The issue is human nature, if you do not provide consistent and clearly visible punishments then players will act as such.

Take eve online as an example, the things that ccp does not tolerate very rarely happen, because provide concise, very visible punishment to deter people from doing it.

But anything that ruins player experience that ccp tolerates? happens en masse.

Take goon squad as an example.

or the bank of eve.

These are major operations that had a negative impact on literally the entire playerbase of eve, every single player from the whales to the little guys just starting out encountered them at some point.

The assumption, that people will just be nice, out of the goodness of their hearts, is quite frankly naive, and its one of the reasons i absolutely fucking hate the automated systems.

Because even if they do work, and we still dont have proof of that only anecdotal evidence from riot employees, and quite frankly with all the bullshit you guys have spun in these past few years i dont trust a red names words farther than i can throw phreaks forehead.

It doesnt feel like it does.

When players are toxic and say "report me it wont do anything" they dont say that to deter reporters, they say that because they believe it.

Fuck when players want to report me for flaming i say that, and i damn well believe it, infact i flame because i believe it, in no other game am i toxic, but boot up a game of league and its like dr jekyll and mr hyde, because i suddenly go from one of the nicest blokes you will ever know, to someone about ready to punch a hole in their monitor screaming at you about how you shouldve been aborted because you cant manage a simple task like pressing a button.

And why do i make that change? part of it is because i wont get punished for it, i dont just think that i know that, and the other reason? its because the rest of the playerbase is like that, monkey see, monkey do.

and quite frankly ill bet you any money for every instance of a ban made by your systems that you can give me, i can probably find five other people flying under the radar.

To summarize, it doesnt matter what your results are internally.

What matters is the response to the system from the community, if the community doesnt feel like they are safe from toxicity using this system then, i dont give two shits if your automated systems are 90% accurate, the community doesnt feel safe period.

And the community comes first, because without us, you wouldnt make a fucking cent.

To clarify my word vomit, the reason the community is still toxic, is EIther 
A) the system just doesnt work in the first place
or
B) the placebo effect, and because the system isnt transparent (like the tribunal was) we honestly cant tell that it works and as such we dont fear the reaper.

because why make a punishment system, and then not instill fear of being punished, the system may aswell not exist in the first place if you dont drill it into peoples heads that it will hit them hard with the book.

I definitely agree with you Yellow, i also feel that the system isnt as transparent as the tribunal and people just feel free to be toxic. 

The tribunal was a great system that self regulated the players. Theres no better system than a system that regulates itself.

Hi Marauder, thanks for taking the time out to answer in so much depth. Glad to know that the associated player has to face the music.

On a side note, i remember that the client used to give prompts to let you know when a player you reported got dealt with accordingly. Similar to how Vainglory's client would give you a speech box saying that a player you recently matched with got banned for toxic behaivour, what happened to that?
Also I think i used to play against you in Twisted tree line along with My Little Pwny. We were talking about when Twisted would have ranked implemented. Glad to see thats finally in rotation!!

Can you explain how feeder detection stuff is linked to the new client release?

Wouldn't it be your Feeder detection system running on your end auditing games and 
spotting this crap. Not some software running on the clients?

Or do you mean that teams busy working on the new client and not working on the
detection systems.

The latter seems like whats going on, There's been no news on you guys doing 
anything about feeders or trolls outside of the IF Detection stuff that came out a year
ago, and clearly still isn't working very well. If it cant even catch a guy going 0/18, 1/25 
etc, its got 0 chance of catching the troll's I run into who bait/fountain dance/
steal lanes/cs/ks and have much better scores but have still intentionally lost the
game.

And yeah, c'mon punishments will 100% stop this experience, this guy wont be playing.
If you did remove them from the game in a timely fashion, a lot less of us would be
 running into them.

Can we have a system where the players not feeding have lightened lp losses but the player who was inting gets huge lp losses/punishments to make up for it? so huge you wouldnt want to int a losing game to save your friends lp?

yeh looks like a smurf someone just trolls on.

Just report and when he gets 4+ reports every game, the system will pick up on it. Its when people just rage leave or dont bother reporting, people get away with it.
